greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Table, row n is nonprime numbers k such that the largest divisor of n*k <= sqrt(n*k) is n.
comment: Every prime > n also has this property.
If a*b is a composite number > n^2, with a <= b, then a*n and b are both > n, and one of them must be <= sqrt(n*a*b); thus n^2 is an upper bound for the numbers in row n.
link: Franklin T. Adams-Watters, Rows n=1..100 of table, flattened
program: a163925_row n = [k | k <- takeWhile (<= n ^ 2) a018252_list,
let k' = k * n, let divs = a027750_row k',
results.author: _Franklin T. Adams-Watters_, Aug 06 2009
